Basic details: Michael Johnson, a 61-year-old male, presents to the clinic with complaints of tremors and walking difficulties.
Vitals:
BP: 140/80 mm Hg
Temp: 98.4°F (36.9°C)
RR: 18/minute
HR: 76/minute, regular
Physical presentation: Exhibit a resting tremor in your hands, noticeable when sitting still. Demonstrate a shuffling gait when asked to walk. Show difficulty in initiating movement and reduced arm swing while walking. If asked about your symptoms, mention that the tremors improve with intentional movement.
Challenging question: "Is this Parkinson's disease? Will I lose my ability to walk?"
